HIGH.chrome.tabs.query: Can retrieve info about all open tabs, including URLs and titles
HIGH.chrome.tabs.executeScript: Can inject and run arbitrary code in web pages
HIGH.chrome.tabs.remove: Can close user tabs without their knowledge
HIGH.chrome.webRequestBlocking: Blocks and modifies outgoing network requests
HIGH.chrome.cookies.getAll: Can access all cookies, including session tokens
HIGH.chrome.management.getAll: Can read all installed extensions, posing fingerprinting risks
HIGH.chrome.debugger.attach: Attaches to tab for full debugging control over page content
HIGH.chrome.nativeMessaging.connect: Communicates with local native apps, possibly bypassing browser sandbox
HIGH.chrome.fileSystem.requestFileSystem: Requests access to sandboxed local file system
HIGH.chrome.clipboardWrite: Can overwrite clipboard without user interaction

MEDIUM.chrome.downloads.download: Can download arbitrary files onto user's machine
MEDIUM.chrome.downloads.setShelfEnabled: Can hide downloads UI, making downloads invisible to user
MEDIUM.chrome.identity.getAuthToken: Grants OAuth2 token access for user identity
MEDIUM.chrome.bookmarks.getTree: Reads user bookmarks, useful for profiling
MEDIUM.chrome.contentSettings.set: Changes site behavior like JS, cookies, etc.
MEDIUM.chrome.storage.sync.set: Saves user-related data in synced cloud storage

LOW.chrome.alarms.create: Schedules future tasks in the background
LOW.chrome.runtime.onInstalled.addListener: Triggers when extension is installed or updated
LOW.chrome.contextMenus.create: Adds entries to the right-click menu
LOW.chrome.i18n.getMessage: Retrieves localized messages for UI display
LOW.chrome.browserAction.setIcon: Changes extension icon in the toolbar
LOW.chrome.tabs.reload: Reloads a tab (no access to content)
LOW.chrome.scripting.executeScript: Can only inject scripts with activeTab permission
LOW.chrome.action.setBadgeText: Sets badge text for toolbar icon
LOW.chrome.storage.local.set: Stores data locally (less privacy concern than sync)
